com.communote.server.core.database.config

Class StandardDatabaseConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.core.database.config.StandardDatabaseConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DatabaseConfiguration
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FulltextSupportingDatabaseConfiguration

    public class StandardDatabaseConfiguration
extends Object
implements DatabaseConfiguration
    DatabaseConfiguration without fulltext support. The HQL fulltext function will be translated to a standard LIKE query.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

      • getConnectionProviderClassName

        public String getConnectionProviderClassName()
        Get the class name of the org.hibernate.connection.ConnectionProvider to use. This implementation will return the value of the system property "communote.connectionProviderClass" or C3P0DataSourceConnectionProvider if the property is not set.
        Specified by:
        getConnectionProviderClassName in interface DatabaseConfiguration
        Returns:
        the full qualified class name of the connection provider

      • getDatepartSQLFunction

        public org.hibernate.dialect.function.SQLFunction getDatepartSQLFunction()
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConfiguration
        Get the SQLFunction that will translate the HQL 'datepart' function to SQL.

        Usage: day_of_date(dateField, alias) where dateField must be one of the DateField constants Example in HQL to return the year of the publication date of a note: "date_part(" + DateField.YEAR + ", note.publication_date)"

        Specified by:
        getDatepartSQLFunction in interface DatabaseConfiguration
        Returns:
        the SQLFunction that will render the HQL 'datepart' function or null if not supported

      • getFulltextParameterValue

        public String getFulltextParameterValue(String pattern,
                                        org.hibernate.criterion.MatchMode matchMode,
                                        boolean doNotUseFulltext)
        Get the (database specific) parameter value for the given pattern Evaluates to the % syntax
        Specified by:
        getFulltextParameterValue in interface DatabaseConfiguration
        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern
        matchMode - the hibernate match mode
        doNotUseFulltext - true if the parameter should use the like wildcards matching even if fulltext is enabled
        Returns:
        the parameter value to be used in the final query

      • getFulltextSQLFunction

        public org.hibernate.dialect.function.SQLFunction getFulltextSQLFunction()
        Return the SQL function that translates the HQL 'fulltext' function to SQL.

        The HQL 'fulltext' function takes two arguments: The field to be search and the string to search for. In HQL the fulltext function has always to be matched against 1, e.g. fulltext(content.content, 'mysearch') = 1. BUT if you want the negation use: not (fulltext(content.content,'mysearch'))

        When building queries with the HQL fulltext function always use the DatabaseConfiguration.getFulltextParameterValue(String, MatchMode) to set the parameter values because the syntax differs per database

        The like function will be returned
        Specified by:
        getFulltextSQLFunction in interface DatabaseConfiguration
        Returns:
        The SQLFunction that will render the HQL 'fulltext' function

      • isExtendSubselectsWithOuterConditions

        public boolean isExtendSubselectsWithOuterConditions()
        Description copied from interface: DatabaseConfiguration
        Determine if subselects should be extended by using conditions of the outer clause.

        See the MSSQL Implementation for an example.

        Specified by:
        isExtendSubselectsWithOuterConditions in interface DatabaseConfiguration
        Returns:
        true if the subselect should be extended

      • isUseFulltextFeature

        public boolean isUseFulltextFeature()
        Specified by:
        isUseFulltextFeature in interface DatabaseConfiguration
        Returns:
        always returns false
